com.anotherservice.db

Class Database

  • Object
    • Database
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Mysql, Oracle, PooledDatabase

    public abstract class Database
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    This class is an abstraction layer for easy access to databases using the java.sql framework. All connections, resources, cleanups and such are thus transparent.
    Author:
    Simon Uyttendaele

        protected String user
        The database user

      • password

        protected String password
        The database password

      • testSelect

        protected String testSelect
        The database dummy SELECT statement. This SQL query will be performed before every other request in order to check that the connection is stil alive.
        Default value : "SELECT 1 FROM DUAL"

      • connection

        protected Connection connection
        The original java.sql.Connection

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Checks whether or not the database is ready to process requests.
        Returns:
        true if the Connection is not isClosed(). false otherwise.

      • finalize

        Closes the database connection.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws SQLException
        Closes the database connection.
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • connect

        protected abstract void connect()
                         throws SQLException
        This method should be implemented in order to (re)establish the connection. This method will be called when a dropped connection is discovered in order to reconnect to the database. (SQLState 08*)
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • clone

        public abstract Database clone()
        Clones this database instance. The returned clone should use the same host, port, database, user, password.
        Overrides:
        clone in class Object

      • insert

        public Long insert(String sql)
            throws SQLException
        Shortcut for an INSERT request.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL request
        Returns:
        the first inserted numeric primary key
        Throws:
        SQLException
        Note:
        this method simply calls query(String, Database.Mode)

      • update

        public Long update(String sql)
            throws SQLException
        Shortcut for an UPDATE request.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL request
        Returns:
        the number of rows updated
        Throws:
        SQLException
        Note:
        this method simply calls query(String, Database.Mode) and ignores the return value

      • delete

        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL request
        Returns:
        the number of rows deleted
        Throws:

      • selectOne

        public Map<String,String> selectOne(String sql)
                             throws SQLException
        Shortcut for a SELECT request with Database.Mode.ONE_ROW.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL request
        Returns:
        the result of the request
        Throws:
        SQLException
        Note:
        this method simply calls query(String, Database.Mode) and returns the value

      • select

        public Vector<Map<String,String>> select(String sql)
                                  throws SQLException
        Shortcut for a SELECT request with Database.Mode.ANY_ROW.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL request
        Returns:
        the result of the request
        Throws:
        SQLException
        Note:
        this method simply calls query(String, Database.Mode) and returns the value

      • query

        public Object query(String sql,
           Database.Mode mode)
             throws SQLException
        Performs the provided request against the underlying database represented by this object. This method creates a new java.sql.Statement and performs an
        • executeQuery() if the mode is Database.Mode.ONE_ROW or Database.Mode.ANY_ROW
        • executeUpdate() if the mode is Database.Mode.NO_ROW
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL request
        mode - The query type
        Returns:
        • the last inserted java.lang.Long primary key (INSERT) or the number of affected rows (UPDATE, DELETE) if the mode is Database.Mode.NO_ROW
        • a Map with column names as keys and their matching values as string if the mode is Database.Mode.ONE_ROW
        • a Vector> for each of the result rows if the mode is Database.Mode.ANY_ROW
        Throws:
        SQLException
        Note:
        an implicit commit() is performed against the Connection after every statement.
